DataElement.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that assesses the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood._An assessment of the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.:An assessment of the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration.

Concepts.definition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.

Concepts.longName: Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide
Concepts.definition: An assessment of the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have pulmonary function tests
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have pulmonary function tests been performed and are pre-study DLCO/VA and FEV1 greater than or equal to 50% of predicted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior history of chemotherapy-induced or radiation-induced pulmonary toxicity, has diffuse capacity of the lung for carbon monoxide (DLCO) been confirmed to be over 60% (adjusted for hemoglobin) by a pulmonary function test prior to study enrollment?
